【考法 1】 adj. 笨拙的：lacking or showing a lack of nimbleness in using one's hands；a lack of skill and tact
【例】turn out to be a clumsy sleight of hand
【近】awkward, ham-handed, heavy-handed, maladroit, unhandy, bungling, inept, maladroit
【考法 2】 adj. 不文雅的：lacking social grace and assurance；showing an inability to move in a graceful manner
【例】be clumsy on the dance floor
【近】awkward, graceless, ungainly, gauche, inelegant, rustic, ungraceful
【考法 3】 adj. 不精致的 hastily or roughly constructed
【例】A clumsy mock-up of the real thing
【近】rough, unrefined
【记】 音：瞌懒贼→瞌睡的懒贼行动笨拙；clump 一团，从中行动就是不灵活
